comments:
build I20050405 + latest runtime, resources, swt, jface, workbench, ide from HEAD

- running my target, an error dialog came up saying it failed during periodic
workspace save.
- the log has:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 4 2 2005-04-07 11:13:48.428
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Periodic workspace save.".
!STACK 0
org.eclipse.core.internal.dtree.ObjectNotFoundException: Tree element / not found.
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.dtree.AbstractDataTree.handleNotFound(AbstractDataTree.java:258)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.dtree.DeltaDataTree.getData(DeltaDataTree.java:593)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.events.ResourceDeltaFactory.createDelta(ResourceDeltaFactory.java:133)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.events.ResourceDeltaFactory.computeDelta(ResourceDeltaFactory.java:60)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.events.NotificationManager.getDelta(NotificationManager.java:224)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.events.NotificationManager.broadcastChanges(NotificationManager.java:138)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.broadcastPostChange(Workspace.java:180)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.endOperation(Workspace.java:912)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.SaveManager.save(SaveManager.java:1018)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.DelayedSnapshotJob.run(DelayedSnapshotJob.java:44)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:67)
I had not made any changes to the workspace.

I spent a couple of hours reviewing this code, but can't see how this error is
possible.  The error indicates that the root node is missing from a freshly
calculated delta tree.  Since even an "empty" delta with no changes has a root,
I can't figure out how this could happen.  I will leave this open awhile longer
to see if it occurs again.

Does the tree have a "closed" or "disposed" state?
Maybe there's a race condition on shutdown.
*** Bug 96697 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Downgrading priority as this was never reproduced.
